headline.main: If bin Laden Is Brought to Trial

lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Al Qaeda Should Be Tried Before the World,'' by Anne-Marie Slaughter (Op-Ed, Nov. 17), overlooks the shortcomings of the criminal justice approach by ignoring the experience of families of victims of international terrorism. The Pan Am Flight 103 families waited nearly nine years from the time of the indictment of two Libyan agents for the criminal justice system to work and have seen only paltry results. In light of such shortcomings, they have instituted civil actions for damages directly against the government of Libya for masterminding the bombing over Lockerbie.
abstract: Prof Allan Gerson letter disputes Anne-Marie Slaughter's November 17 Op-Ed article, which argues that Al Qaeda terrorists should be tried before international tribunal rather than American military commission
